meanings.definition: To make a sharp, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The old door was cricking as it swung back and forth.
meanings.sent2: I heard the gate cricking in the wind last night.
meanings.sent3: The cricking noise of the rusty swing set made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The crickets cricking in the night created a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The cricking of the car brakes warned us of danger ahead.

meanings.sent1: The cricking of the rusty hinges echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent2: She woke up to the cricking of the floorboards under her bed.
meanings.sent3: The cricking of the old radio made it seem like it was talking to us.
meanings.sent4: The cricking of the branches in the wind sounded like a spooky melody.
meanings.sent5: The cricking of the typewriter keys filled the room with a rhythmic sound.

meanings.definition: The action of making a sharp, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The constant cricking of the cicadas filled the summer air.
meanings.sent2: The cricking of the pen on paper was the only sound in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The cricking of the old record player added a vintage charm to the room.
meanings.sent4: The cricking of the ice cubes in the glass signaled the start of the party.
meanings.sent5: The cricking of the old clock marked the passing of each hour.
